data.title: Kirkland Performance Center
data.text:
KPC Presents: 2024-2025!

Tuesday, August 27, 2024 – 7pm

Tuesday, July 1, 2025 – 7pm

SNEAK PEEK! We are thrilled with the growing list of artists in our KPC Presents series for 2024-2025! See below for ticket package details, and purchase your 3-pack or 5-pack today!

New shows are being added all the time … so stay tuned!

Click here to purchase a Pick 3 Package:

Purchase tickets for any 3 KPC Presents shows

Pay only a single $15 ticket fee for all…

Charlie Musselwhite

Tuesday, August 27, 2024 – 7:00 PM

KPC is thrilled to welcome legendary American blues musician Charlie Musselwhite. Starting out in the early 60s, from Mississippi to Memphis, Chicago to California, Musselwhite’s life has been steeped in the blues. More than 20 albums later he is at the top of his game, a revered elder statesman of the blues nowhere near ready to hang up his harps, his depth of expression as a singer and an…

Wild Rumours: A Fleetwood Mac Experience

Friday, September 13, 2024 – 7:00 PM

SPONSORED BY

Karen Snepp | Diane Fessler | Betty Graham

Wild Rumours – based in Seattle, WA – coalesced around the concept of performing entire albums, faithfully and in sequence. The core of a Wild Rumours show features all the classic material from both the 1975 Fleetwood Mac and 1978 Rumours albums, along with other hit songs from the FM catalog. Focusing on the apex Buckingham-Nicks era material, Wild Rumours creates an authentic…

Buffett's Margaritaville

Saturday, September 14, 2024 – 8:00 PM

Welcome to the electrifying tribute show to the one and only Jimmy Buffet – Buffett’s Margaritaville! Get ready to be transported to a tropical paradise, where the sun is shining, the waves are crashing, and the margaritas are flowing.

This show is an explosive celebration of the iconic music of Jimmy Buffet, featuring all of his greatest hits that will have you singing along and dancing in your seat. With…

An Evening With Grammy Award-Winning Rebirth Brass Band

Wednesday, September 18, 2024 – 7:00 PM

For almost 4 decades, the Grammy winning Rebirth Brass Band has been “stunning” fans with a fiery live show and a rich musical catalog. Their trademark sound pays homage to the New Orleans brass band tradition while weaving a tapestry that combines elements of jazz, funk, soul, R&B and the sounds from the streets they grew up on. From their legendary 25+ year run of Tuesday nights at…

Marc Ribot Quartet Featuring Mary Halvorson

Tuesday, September 24, 2024 – 7:00 PM

ARTIST WEBSITE

Marc Ribot Bio: Marc Ribot, who the New York Times describes as “a deceptively articulate artist who uses inarticulateness as an expressive device,” has released 25 albums under his own name over a 40-year career, exploring everything from the pioneering jazz of Albert Ayler to the Cuban son of Arsenio Rodríguez. His solo release, “Silent Movies” (Pi Recording 2010) has been described as a “down-in…

Quest - A Dance Journey by FLOCK

Saturday, September 28, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Renowned international contemporary dance company FLOCK brings their latest touring show “Quest” from its tour in Europe. Choreographed by Alice Klock and Florian Lochner this vibrant production centers around six protagonists each with their own storyline or quest. Follow these character’s individual hero’s journeys to their epic conclusions. Featuring 6 extraordinary dancers and a stunning soundtrack this piece ushers audiences into a thrilling world of movement, myth, and…

Late Nite Catechism

Sunday, September 29, 2024 – 3:00 PM

Step back into your youth with Late Nite Catechism- a hilarious theatrical experience like no other! Join the irrepressible Sister as she leads her class through a riotous journey of laughter and nostalgia. From glow-in-the-dark rosaries to cheeky antic, every moment is packed with fun and surprises. Whether you’re a model student or a bit mischievous, Sister’s classroom is where you’ll want to be…

The Young Dubliners with special guests The Stout Pounders

Thursday, October 3, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Sponsored by Katharine Dickin

After thirty years as one of the world’s leading Celtic Rock bands, The Young Dubliners have begun work on their tenth studio album (with longtime producer Irish-born Tim Boland) while still maintaining their busy tour schedule. They have returned to the road post-pandemic stronger than ever and determined to bring their fusion of Celtic and rock music to as many people as they…

Piano Men: Generations

Saturday, October 12, 2024 – 7:30 PM

Get ready for an electrifying musical extravaganza like no other! Introducing “PIANO MEN: GENERATIONS,” a sensational celebration of the legendary Billy Joel and Elton John, brought to life by the extraordinary father and son duo of Terry and Nick Davies. These two virtuosos are about to take you on a mesmerizing journey through the timeless hits that have captured the hearts of music lovers for decades…

Swan Lake

Thursday, October 17, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Friday, October 18, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Swan Lake is a ballet masterpiece that tells the story of a prince who falls in love with a beautiful swan princess under a spell. The ballet is renowned for its stunning choreography, intricate set design, and Tchaikovsky’s captivating music. Its themes of love, sacrifice, and redemption continue to resonate with audiences of all ages and backgrounds, making it a timeless classic that has endured for more than a…

Nite Wave's 80's Party! Featuring: Nite Wave (80's New Wave) w/ DJ Dance Dance

Saturday, October 19, 2024 – 8:00pm

Come dance the night away with local favorites NITE WAVE, as they explore all the nostalgic favorites from the 80s – from Prince to Depeche Mode to Duran Duran to INXS and more! Nite Wave pays homage to the artists who designed a decade and bring incredible energy to their shows that is unique and infectious.

This show has an optional $35 VIP Add-On per ticket which includes one-night…

The Brothers Four: Greenfields Forever!

Sunday, October 20, 2024 – 7:00pm

SPONSORED BY

Katharine Dickin | Rich & Patricia Miailovich

Legendary, pioneering voices from the “Great American Folk-Revival”, The Brothers Four have become one of the longest-performing and best-selling musical groups in history. With original voices still on board, their fresh natural sound and instantly recognized harmonies continue to entertain audiences of all ages. Their Grammy and Oscar-nominated Greatest Hits will make you smile, and sing along and…

Girls Night: The Musical

Friday, October 25, 2024 – 7:30 PM

GIRLS NIGHT: THE MUSICAL has been thrilling audiences and earning rave reviews since its sensational Off-Broadway debut. This touching and hilarious ‘tell-it-like-it-is’ musical takes audiences on a journey into the lives of a group of female friends. Audience members can’t help but laugh, cry and sing and dance in the aisles! Follow five friends as they visit their past, celebrate their present, and look…

Jenner Fox Band featuring the music of Paul Simon

Sunday, October 27, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Jenner Fox Band is a Paul Simon tribute band featuring Pacific Northwest all stars musicians from Polecat, Petty or Not, Skillethead, and the Jenner Fox Band. The ensemble was formed on a fateful election night when they found themselves listening to “American Tune” and discovered a mutual reverence for Paul Simon. National Guitar performs a range of Simon’s music from Garfunkle to Graceland and everywhere in between. Come prepared…

Sex & the City - A Super Unauthorized Musical Parody

Thursday, October 31, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Follow our favorite single gals looking for love in the big city. We tackle serious questions like “will I ever find the one”, “can you ever really be over your ex” and “for the third time, it’s a neck massager!” Come join Carrie, Miranda, Charlotte, and Samantha on a hilarious trip through New York in the 90s…

Elevate KPC Celebration + Fundraiser!

Saturday, November 2, 2024 – 7:30pm

Join us in building a new theater for the next generation with live music, dinner, drinks, and dancing onstage at KPC! Experience and participate in our vision for the future by investing in the creative arts at Kirkland Performance Center.

For more information on the Elevate KPC campaign, visit kpcenter.org/elevatekpc…

The Man in Black: A Tribute to Johnny Cash

Wednesday, November 13, 2024 – 7:00pm

With his strikingly similar looks, baritone voice, and spot-on mannerisms, Shawn Barker’s uncanny resemblance to the original “Man In Black” revitalizes the true character and spirit of Mr. Cash himself, one of America’s greatest musical icons, for a truly one-of-a-kind show. The energetic show features Barker in character throughout the entire evening, walking the audience through each era of Cash’s life and music…

The Best of Pink Floyd performed by Long Live Rock

Friday, November 15, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Sponsored by Mike & Kim Convertino

Those favorite hits you wait until the very end of the night to hear? The epic ones that only get played at the encore? Long Live Rock rocks those song after song for an entire show. Long Live Rock is a collective from Seattle, WA that loves performing the greatest rock music by the most favorite classic rock bands of all time. Long Live…

Jake Shimabukuro: Holidays in Hawai'i

Wednesday, November 20, 2024 – 7:00pm

Sponsored by:

Liz Hunt & Benn Schreiber | J. Donald Dicks & Merrily Dicks | Steve & Gail Brilling

Celebrate the Holiday Season with Jake Shimabukuro’s Spectacular Show: Holidays in Hawai’i! Get ready to immerse yourself in the magical spirit of the holidays as the ukulele virtuoso and beloved ambassador of aloha, Jake Shimabukuro, presents his highly anticipated seasonal extravaganza! This festive show promises to be a sensational gift to…

Lizzy and The Triggermen

Thursday, November 21, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Sponsored by Carolyn Hayek

ARTIST WEBSITE

Dubbed “10-piece jazz sensations” by LA Weekly, Lizzy & the Triggermen transport you back to the glamour of the Jazz Age, but with a sound and swagger that is thrillingly new (think Duke Ellington meets Amy Winehouse). The show is a joyously subversive mixture of vintage pop, show tunes, and biting originals that highlight Lizzy’s wicked sense of humor (which she previously…

Nutcracker

Tuesday, December 10, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Wednesday, December 11, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Thursday, December 12, 2024 – 7:00 PM

Nutcracker is a ballet that will always be timeless. It has been loved for more than 100 years by many generations of children and adults from different countries all around the world. The performance is based on the fairy tale classic of German literature by E. Hoffmann “The Nutcracker and the Mouse King”, it is a mystical story about a handsome prince who was bewitched into an ugly doll, and…

Edna Vazquez of Pink Martini

Sunday, April 13, 2025 – 7:00 PM

Edna Vazquez presents DE COLORES, an intimate and personal solo performance, displaying the full range of all of her colorful facets in music, from covers of Mexican folk songs, to trova, pop, rock, r&b, and distinctive originals in Spanish and English.

Edna Vazquez is a fearless singer, songwriter, composer, and guitarist whose powerful voice and musical talent transcend the boundaries of language to engage and uplift her audience…

Steve Hofstetter

Wednesday, May 28, 2025 – 7:00 PM

One of YouTube’s most popular comics with over 225 million views and half a billion more on Facebook, Steve Hofstetter is also the host of Finding Babe Ruth on FS1. Hofstetter was the host and executive producer of Laughs (FOX) and he has been on CBS’ The Late Late Show, E! True Hollywood Story, Comics Unleashed, and more. He’s sold out shows in hundreds of cities and dozens…

Napoleon Dynamite LIVE! 20th Anniversary Celebration

Saturday, June 14, 2025 – 5:30 PM

Sponsored by Neal & Sandy Perlmutter

A Very Special Evening with Jon Heder, Jon Gries, & Efren Ramirez (meet & greet with the cast available for $112 add-on, does not include show ticket)

Meet & Greet – 5:30 PM (must purchase ticket add-on)Screening – 7:00 PM

The beloved indie classic “Napoleon Dynamite” was released 20 years ago. Since then, much has changed; but the characters, as enduring…
